sources.title: Dressed To Kill
sources.description: This film has fallen into the Public Domain.

sources.title: Dressed to Kill
sources.description: Aka 'Sherlock Holmes in Dressed To Kill' - features Basil Rathbone as Sherlock Holmes.

sources.title: ANOTHER MYSTERY NIGHT AT THE BIJOU (double feature)
sources.description: This is a simulated Sherlock Holmes double feature program at a second-run movie house in the 1940s. The evening's entertainment begins with coming attractions and a cartoon, followed by "Dressed to Kill." The intermission featurette is the Robert Benchley short, "A Night at the Movies." The second feature presentation is "The Secret Weapon." NOTE: All the items in this mysterious simulation can be found in various IA collections.

metadata.Plot: While taking a shower, Kate Miller, a middle-aged, sexually frustrated New York City housewife, has a rape fantasy while her husband stands at the sink shaving. Later that day, after complaining to her psychiatrist Dr. Robert Elliott about her husband's pathetic performance in bed, she meets a strange man at a museum and returns to his apartment where they continue an adulterous encounter that began in the taxicab. Before she leaves his apartment, she finds papers which certify that the man has a venereal disease. Panicked, Kate rushes into the elevator, but has to return to his apartment when she realizes she's forgotten her wedding ring. When the elevator doors open, she's brutally slashed to death by a tall blonde woman wearing dark sunglasses. Liz Blake, a high-class call girl, is the only witness to the murder and she becomes the prime suspect and the murderer's next target. Liz is rescued from being killed by Kate's son Peter, who enlists the help of Liz to catch his mother's killer as Detective Marino, who's in charge of the case, is uncooperative in the investigation.
metadata.Actors: Michael Caine, Angie Dickinson, Nancy Allen
